repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
â€¦ling

Problem: When creating floating window from existing window, the window-local 'statusline' option is inherited, causing unwanted statusline display. Additionally, with laststatus=3 (global statusline), the early return skipped clearing wp->w_redr_status flag.

Solution: Clear inherited window-local 'statusline' in win_new_float for style="minimal". Restructure win_redr_status to always clear the flag before any early returns, and only render floating window statusline when window-local 'statusline' is explicitly set.

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.body: I think floatwins should be able to show a local statusline even if `laststatus=0`. But don't need to block this PR on that.

comment_regular_data.body: That looks like it fixes the issue with telescope and lualine ðŸ‘

Initially, laststatus was taken into account â€” see the context of the earlier PRs. But in the end it was ignored. If values 0, 1, and 2 are not respected, then why should 3 be respected?

> But globalstatus or laststatus=3 is still broken.

what's broken.. I didnâ€™t understand before comment for 3 and could you provide a reproduce step.

Because `laststatus=3` is fundamentally different from the other values (arguably, it should have been a different option, but I understand why implementing it this way was easier). So the argument is that "yes, `laststatus=3` should be taken into account even if the other values aren't". ("Broken" is a strong word; I'd rather say "doesn't behave as I would expect, given the design of `laststatus=3`".)

(To be honest, I still don't understand the value of having status bars in floating windows; the original issue was a bit vague for my taste and didn't really make a thought-through proposal for how this should work in practice, given the range of related options.)

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/36521#issuecomment-3544961896 I have consider it.. readd it support only 1 and 2 of laststasus and floating window-local stl expr option not empty will render line

Yeah saying not working as expected would be correct way to say it rather then broken.

Basically, laststatus=3 takes aways statuslines from individual windows and renders only one statusline in last line of neovim.
In this case the statusline is rendered in contest of the current focus window. Means say you have 2 vertical splits. and each have seperate filename. Now you're showing filename on your statusline. If you're currently focusing on split-1 then  filename for split 1 is shown at last line of neovim (above the msgline) and if you switch focus to split-2 it shows the file name for 2nd split.

It's not even just that the stl expression is evaluated in context of the current focus window. But also say both splits have it's own window-local statusline option. Based on which window is in focus that windows statusline will be shown in the gobalstatusline (last line of neovim). 

Basically what globalstatus being on (laststatus=3) meant windows won't render their own statusline. Instead whatever window currently in focus will show it's statusline at lastline of neovim (globalstatus)

Before the float-statusline pr This worked with floating windows too. Meaning if you have focus on a floating window the global statusline would show the statusline in context of that floating window (means the window local/global value of statusline option is used and evaluated in context of the floating window) . Basically gloabl status already supported floating windows.. But these changes are breaking that expected behavior that with `laststatus=3` neovim only has one statusline and the current focusing windows statusline get's rendered there. 

I think with your last patch in this pr now statusline is not shown in floats on laststatus=3 but the globalstatusline doesnt' get evaluated in floating windows context like before.

Also, on laststatus=3 the global statusline still vanishes upon refresh Before refresh After forced refresh with `` The statusline comes back focus is back to a non-floating window. I think the global statusline is just not getting rendered when focus is in floating window? That might also be the reason why it doesn't get evaluated in floating windows context as I mentioned earlier.
I added some tests related to the value 3, and it should match what you described. how about now
It works great now ðŸ‘Œ. Thanks.

> laststatus=3 or globalstatus was introduced to consolidate multiple statuslines into just one at the end of neovim-screen. It's a bit different then other laststatus options. In that sense with globalstatus set floating windows should utilize that global-statusline too instead of having one for each floating window.

Reviewing https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/17266 , and this explanation in particular: 

> have a single global statusline for the current window at the bottom of the screen

If focusing a floating window shows the *floatwin-local statusline* in the *global statusline* with `laststatus=3`, then yes, that makes sense.

> To be honest, I still don't understand the value of having status bars in floating windows

For arbitrary application-specific purposes, same as any other window-specific option.

One use-case is externalized (GUI) windows: https://x.com/akiyosi_x/status/1994026732685558187

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/8a626e5c4a5254c9ec952abe6ffe1e9b6fef9b2b/runtime/doc/windows.txt#L130

I think this line in documentation should be changed?

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

title: fix(float): respect statusline=3, don't inherit local 'statusline'
